intro: Psychotria viticina, commonly known as the Amazonian arrow poison or curare plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon rainforest. The plant contains various alkaloids, including curare, which have been historically used by indigenous peoples for hunting. Its leaves and roots are often harvested for their medicinal and toxic properties. Psychotria viticina is characterized by its small, white or greenish flowers and elliptical leaves.
